results.title: La Voie Lactee = the Milky Way
results.brief_description:
Pierre and Jean journey to a holy shrine in Northern Spain (Santiago de Compostella). Are they pilgrims or tramps? No one knows their identity or their true motives. During this timeless intitiatic journey, their faith is severely tested by some of the irreverent characters they confront in the course of their pilgrimage. Even chance meetings with Jesus Christ, the Virgin Mary and the Devil are not quite what Pierre and Jean have been prepared for in their religious training. This late Bunuel film is one of his most direct treatment of the Catholic Church and the six central mysteries of Catholic dogma: the nature of God, Christ, the Virgin Mary, the Eucharist, divine grace and evil.

Credits: Producer, Serge Silberman ; director, Luis Bunuel ; writers, Luis Bunuel, Jean-Claude Carriere ; photography, Christian Matras ; music, Luis Bunuel.
Cast: Delphine Seyrig, Laurent Terzieff, Ellen Bahl, Paul Frankeur, Agnes Capri, Julien Berthau, Augusta Carriere, Julien Guiomar, Muni, Georges Marchal.

results.title: La Vie de Famille
results.brief_description:
Emmanuel lives with his second wife, Mara, and her 20 year old daughter, Natacha. The relationship between Emmanuel and his step-daughter are tense, and an argument erupts just when Emmanuel is about to go and join his first wife, Lili and his young daughter Elise for the week-end. Emmanuel and Elise take a trip from the south of France into Spain, working on a film project. Through a series of round-about conversations, Emmanuel manages to open up a few channels of communication with Elise — channels that expand even wider when he uses the technique of talking into her video camera to express thoughts and feelings that otherwise would have remained hidden.

Credits: Producer, Jean-Francois Lepetit ; director, Jacques Doillon ; writers, Jacques Doillon, Jean-Francois Goyet ; photography, Michel Carre.
Cast: Sami Frey, Mara Goyet, Juliet Berto, Juliette Binoche, Aina Walle.

results.title: La Vie de Chateau = the Good Life
results.creator_credit: Ancinex, Cobela Films, La Gueville, Nicole Stephane and Jean-Paul Rappeneau
results.brief_description: Catherine Deneuve plays a young woman married to a penniless lord of the manor in Normandy, during the war. In this light hearted comedy, life is rather dull until the English land, and then everything changes.
results.title_for_label: La Vie de Chateau = the Good Life
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ancinex, Cobela Films, La Gueville, Nicole Stephane and Jean-Paul Rappeneau

results.title: La Vie a L'envers = Life Upside Down
results.brief_description:
An ordinary young Paris office worker suddenly decides to retreat into his own inner world, giving up his loquacious new wife, his friends, work and possessions. He ends up contentedly staring at a blank wall in the bare room of mental clinic. The theme of alienation, a prevalent one in the 1960s, has seldom been explored with such wry wit and sensitivity, although the film’s attitude to its hero remains ambiguous. Awards: Cannes Festival (1964): Critics’ Week Prize ; Venice Film Festival (1964): Prize for the First Work. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Director, Alain Jessua ; writer, Alain Jessua ; photography, Jacques Robin ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Charles Denner, Anna Gaylor, Jean Yanne, Yvonne Clech, Robert Bousquet, Nicole Gueden, Guy Saint-Jean, Francois Moncey, Jean Dewewer.

results.title: La Trobe Lifeskills. Diary 2
results.brief_description: An anonymous digital dairy created by a young person as part of a day long workshop run by ACMI. Each diary is scripted and a voiceover recorded by the individual young person. Some diaries use photographs brought in by the participant, but the primary visual content is often black and white, ‘stock’ footage of a poetic nature. At no point should the creator or school be positively identified when screening this work.

results.title: La Trobe Cottage [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions, Ampol Petroleum Ltd, John Kingsford-Smith and National Trust
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Heritage”.
A look at La Trobe Cottage, Victoria’s first Government House. Brought out from England, it was assembled on a foundation of hand-make bricks.

results.title: La Triche = the Cheat
results.brief_description:
Michel Verta, a police officer, lives happy in Bordeaux with his wife Nathalie and their child. From time to time he indulges in homosexual encounters. During a routine crime enquiry in a night-club, he meets Bernard, a musician, with whom he falls in love. Michel’s family finds out, and their reactions to the news are quite predictable. When Bernard accidentally kills a man who has been blackmailing him, the gay couple’s troubles are intensified, especially since Michel tries to illegally protect Bernard. The two lovers are caught in an increasing spiral of lies and despair.

Credits: Producer, Denise Petitdidier ; director, Yannick Bellon ; writers, Yannick Bellon, Alain Marcel, Remi Waterhouse ; photography, Houchang Baharlou ; music, Catherine Lara.
Cast: Victor Lanoux, Xavier Deluc, Anny Duperey, Michel Galabru, Valerie Mairesse, Michel Galabru.

results.title: La Traviata
results.creator_credit: Accent Films, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Tarak Ben Ammar and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: This is Zeffirelli’s lavish production of Verdi’s much-loved opera, “La Traviata”, starring Teresa Stratas and Placido Domingo. Violetta Valery is giving a party to celebrate her return to society after an illness - here she meets Alfredo, son of a wealthy merchant, and they fall in love. They live happily together until Alfredo’s father comes to Violetta and asks her to end the affair in order to spare his family further dishonour. The heartbreak destroys Violetta’s health completely, and Alfredo realises what Violetta has sacrificed - but it is too late!
